User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; rv:1.7.3) Gecko/20040913 Firefox/0.10
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.1; rv:1.7.3) Gecko/20040913 Firefox/0.10

Hi, I'm not sure if this was intentional or not, but it looks like the amazon
search box is adding someone's affiliate code to all its queries (giving that
someone a commission of something like 5% on the resulting amazon sales).

In the src tarball that I downloaded, the tag is added by the file
mozilla/browser/locales/en-US/searchplugins/amazondotcom.src.

Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select Amazon from the search box dropdown
2. Type in a search (say "test"), hit enter
3. Watch the affiliate code appear in the results url

Actual Results:  
I am directed to
http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/external-search/104-6997690-0573536?field-keywords=test&mode=blended&tag=kurona-20&sourceid=Mozilla-search
which contains the offending affiliate code

Expected Results:  
Not added an affiliate tag
comments.author: ljmatkins@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
That is indeed Mozilla.org's affiliate code.  Shouldn't impact performance in
any way and as mentiond in another bug, Amazon is on the top 10 list of Mycroft
downloads. So just another way to keep the Foundation lights turned on.  We can
revisit if people don't feel that Amazon is useful in the search bar (and we'll
know that with preview release.)
